alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 4:12PM CDT until April 15 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Camden, Hickory, Miller and Pulaski. In southwest Missouri, Dallas, Laclede and Polk. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 412 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Niangua at County Road 200, Dry Auglaize Creek at Freedom Ridge Road, Lindley Creek at Mathis Road, Mountain Creek at Kinfolk Road, Wet Glaize at Carrol Cave Road, Cahoochie Creek at Highway BB and Ingalls Creek at Highway HH. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Osage Beach, Camdenton, Buffalo, Lake Ozark, Urbana, Macks Creek, Pittsburg, Polk, Linn Creek, Halfway, Louisburg, Bagnell, Brumley, Lakeside, Leadmine, Roach, Branch, Tunas, Eldridge, Plad, Decaturville, Old Linn Creek, Green Bay Terrace, Pumpkin Center, Montreal, Freedom, Nemo, Kaiser, Lakeview, Goodson, Lake of The Ozarks, Pomme de Terre Lake, Ha Ha Tonka State Park and Lake of The Ozarks State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
